climbs.name: Little Shimmy In A Conga Line

content.description:
Coming soon.

This is a traverse that starts SDS inside the cave...out...and up.  It's a highball if you commit to topping out.
content.protection:
Pads and spotters, not a clean landing...but it is flat.

If you climb any of the problems on Morph Dusseldorf and plan on topping out, you may want to climb in a harness and trail a rope. There are a few pines you can rap off, there are no rap anchors at this time, but some will be installed soon.
content.location:
Coming soon.

Begin in the cave opposite "

Jigsaw Earth

" and traverse across that problem as well...you can call it good after completing the traverse or sack it up and commit to topping out on the slab.

Jigsaw Earth

content.protection:

Gear to 2 bolt anchor with quicklinks.

content.description:
There is lots of beta for the multitude of problems and variations found in this spot of this boulder alone.

Jigsaw Earth starts on an incut jug to climber's right, this is the last feature before the boulder goes back to slab.

Essentially it is a SDS or campus board start...you have no feet, until you open up the next sequence which gets you a right heel hook.

You are now hooked up and matched on a nice rail, pump it, and dyno for the sloper above you. If you stick the sloper, you are set to bring up your left leg and get a good left heel hook to pump it up and through.

You can keep going up, I usually down-climb from this point.

On the opposite side of the boulder I installed a two bolt rap station with quicklinks.

"

Little Shimmy In A Conga Line

".
content.protection:
Pads and spotters, not a clean landing...but it is flat.

If you climb any of the problems on Morph Dusseldorf and plan on topping out, you may want to climb in a harness and trail a rope. There are a few pines you can rap off, there are no rap anchors at this time, but some will be installed soon.
content.location: This is on what I call the front of Morph, which is facing the Southeast and is the side you will see upon approach.

content.description:
"Bazaar Escape" is a variation of "

Little Shimmy In A Conga Line

" that takes you out of the overhang and up the .10+ slab to top out.
